subject: Re: Page Speed: Permission to Adjust Image Sliders
preview: Hi Maddie,  Thank you so much for trusting us with this!  We’ve now made the recommended updates to the homepage, keeping everything light-touch and within the 2-hour window as planned.  Here’s a

full_threads.body:
Hi Maddie,

Thank you so much for trusting us with this!

We’ve now made the recommended updates to the homepage, keeping everything light-touch and within the 2-hour window as planned.

Here’s a quick look at the improvements:
  • Before: PageSpeed Insights
  • After: PageSpeed Insights

The page is now passing Core Web Vitals, with faster load times and a smoother user experience overall.

Let us know if there's anything else you'd like us to look at—we're always happy to help.

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Allie Borcena

full_threads.body:
Hi Manuel,

All good, sometimes it just takes a second set of eyes! Really appreciate you giving it a solid go.

Based on my research:
  1. Enable "Remove Unused CSS"
    Enable "Defer JavaScript"
    Article: https://wp-rocket.me/google-core-web-vitals-wordpress/improve-largest-contentful-paint/

Passing this along to Joel now to take a closer look.

@joel , when you get a chance, can you check what's going on here and let us know once it’s sorted? Let me know if I can hop in this as well 🙏

Thanks both!

Hi @allieB Sorry I did my best but doesn't work.

Hi @joel, could you please check what might be causing the issue? I’ve already changed the slider to a single image banner and optimized some of the images, but the performance still isn't improving as expected.

Also, could you try running a speed test on your end to see if it works and matches our results?
Thanks!

https://pagespeed.web.dev/analysis/https-littlescribblers-com-au/u7d9izmboq?form_factor=mobile
Hey @manuel just draft the note here, I'll draft the email afterwards 🙏 to Madeleine. Thank you so much

On 17 Jul 2025, at 10:20 am, Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:

Hi Renee,

No problems!

So right now, the homepage slider is loading several large images all at once - which slows the page down, especially on mobile. This is one of the main reasons the site is failing Google's Core Web Vitals test.

One option to improve speed is to remove the slider and replace it with a single high-quality hero image. It'll still look great but will load much faster. This is the fastest option, but we lose the slider.

The other path is to optimise the images and add lazy loading them (i.e. they only load when needed).

We will keep it under 2 hours, with the primary goal getting the core website vitals passing.

Let us know if you're happy for us to proceed or prefer to leave for now.

Thanks,
Andy

On 16 Jul 2025, at 2:02 pm, Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:

Hi Renee,

We regularly do optimisation work on the Little Scribblers site to keep it fast.

We found that the homepage slider images are contributing to high load times, specifically LCP (Largest Contentful Paint), which affects the Core Web Vitals score.

Can we have your permission to adjust the way these slider images are handled?

Let me know if you're happy for us to go ahead with this, and we'll take care of the rest.

Thanks,
Andy
--

Andy Crebar

Director
0480 801 428
